questiontext.text:
Exercise

Given a set \(A\), its complement \(A'\) and a universal set \(S\), which of the following expressions are true?

generalfeedback.text: The complement set \(A'\) consists of all elements in the universal set that are not in set \(A\), so \(A \cup A' = S\) and \(A \cap A' = \emptyset\). Also, the subset sequence \(\emptyset \subset A \subset S\) means means that a union between any pair equates to the larger set, \(A \cup \emptyset = A\), and an intersection equates to the smaller set, \(A \cap S = A\).
